sen.j: 岩切城（いわきりじょう）は、宮城県仙台市宮城野区岩切にある、峻険な山城である。
sen.e: Iwakiji-jo Castle is a mountain castle in a difficult terrain in Iwakiri, Miyagino Ward, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture.
Iwakiji-jo Castle is a castle situated on a steep mountain in Iwakiri, Miyagino Ward, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・「mountain」を削除・「in a difficult terrain」→「situated on a steep mountain」
sen.e: Iwakiji-jo Castle is a castle situated on a steep mountain in Iwakiri, Miyagino Ward, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture.

sen.j: 高森山にあることから、別名を高森城（たかもりじょう）という。
sen.e: It is also called Takamori-jo Castle since it is located in Mt. Takamori.
It is also called Takamori-jo Castle because it is located on Mt. Takamori.
It is also called Takamori-jo Castle because it is located on Mt. Takamori.

tit.cmt: ・「Site」を削除・Title caseにしました

sen.j: 東西約500メートル、南北約400メートルの天険の地を城域としている。
sen.e: A natural strategic poing consisting of about 500 meters in east-west direction and about 400 meters in south-north direction was used for the site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The castle is situated on steep terrain, with an elevation of approximately 500m in the east and west, and approximately 400m in the north and south.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: The castle is situated on steep terrain, with an elevation of approximately 500m in the east and west, and approximately 400m in the north and south.

sen.j: 標高106メートルの高森山の尾根を3段ないし4段に削平して中心となる曲輪を設けた。
sen.e: The ridge of Mt. Takamori, whose peak's height is 106, was shaven to make three or four flat steps, and Kuruwa (walls of a castle), the center of the castle was establised.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The ridge of the 106m high Mt. Takamori was flattened into three or four steps and the central walls were created.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: The ridge of the 106m high Mt. Takamori was flattened into three or four steps and the central walls were created.

sen.j: 峰続きの台地や谷を隔てた丘陵や台地の各所にも曲輪を置いて堀割を造って防御をかためている。
sen.e: Walls of a castle (Kuruwa) and ditches were made on the tableland continuing peaks, hillside over the valley, and many points on the tableland to build up its defense against their enemies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Defenses was reinforced by the building of castle walls on each of the hills and plateaus that separate the plateaus and valleys of successive peaks, and the construction of ditches.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: Defenses was reinforced by the building of castle walls on each of the hills and plateaus that separate the plateaus and valleys of successive peaks, and the construction of ditches.

sen.j: 岩切は古代、奥大道が陸奥国の国府、多賀城へ続く道との、交差地点に位置した。
sen.e: In ancient times, Iwakiri was located at the crossing point of Oku-omichi Way leading to Taga-jo Castle, in the provincial capital of Mutsu province.
In ancient times, Iwakiri was located at the intersection of Oku-omichi Road which led to Taga-jo Castle, the kokufu (provincial office), in Mutsu province.
sen.cmt: ・「crossing point」→「intersection」・「Oku-omichi Way」→「Oku-omichi Road」・「leading」→「which led」・翻訳漏れを修正
sen.e: In ancient times, Iwakiri was located at the intersection of Oku-omichi Road which led to Taga-jo Castle, the kokufu (provincial office), in Mutsu province.

sen.j: 多賀城に隣接しており、陸奥国の交通の要衝である。
sen.e: It was located next to Taga-jo Castle, and it was an important point in the transportation of Mutsu province.
It was located next to Taga-jo Castle, and was an important point in the transportation of Mutsu province.
It was located next to Taga-jo Castle, and was an important point in the transportation of Mutsu province.

sen.j: 古代の岩切には多数の市場ができ、東北地方最大の商業地域となった。
sen.e: In the ancient Iwakiri, there were a lot of markets, which made Iwakiri the largest commercial area in Tohoku district.
There were many markets in ancient Iwakiri, making it the largest commercial area in the Tohoku region.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに再翻訳しました
sen.e: There were many markets in ancient Iwakiri, making it the largest commercial area in the Tohoku region.

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)の初期、後醍醐天皇が皇子・義良親王（後の後村上天皇）を陸奥守、北畠顕家らとともに陸奥国府、多賀城へ派遣すると、多賀城に陸奥将軍府が樹立された。
sen.e: In the former Nanbokucho period, when Emperor Godaigo sent Imperial Prince Norinaga (later Emperror Gomurakami) together with Akiie KITABATAKE, Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and others to Taga-jo Castle, Mutsu Shogunfu (local government of Mutsu) was established in Taga-jo Castle.

The Mutsu Shogunfu (local government of Mutsu) was established in the early Northern and Southern Courts period when Emperor Go-Daigo dispatched his son - Imperial Prince Norinaga (who later became Emperor Go-Murakami), Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) Akiie KITABATAKE and others to Taga-jo Castle which served as the provincial office of Mutsu province.
sen.cmt: ・「Emperor Godaigo」→「Emperor Go-Daigo」・「Emperror Gomurakami」→「Emperro Go-Murakami」・ナチュラルに再翻訳しました
sen.e: The Mutsu Shogunfu (local government of Mutsu) was established in the early Northern and Southern Courts period when Emperor Go-Daigo dispatched his son - Imperial Prince Norinaga (who later became Emperor Go-Murakami), Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) Akiie KITABATAKE and others to Taga-jo Castle which served as the provincial office of Mutsu province.

sen.j: 現地、東北武士の代表者は、伊達行朝と結城宗広である。
sen.e: The representatives of worriers in Tohoku area were Yukitomo DATE and Munehiro YUKI.
The representatives of the samurai in Tohoku region were Yukitomo DATE and Munehiro YUKI.
The representatives of the samurai in Tohoku region were Yukitomo DATE and Munehiro YUKI.

sen.j: 奥羽軍は京都で北朝 (日本)方の足利尊氏らと戦い、尊氏を九州へ敗走させた。
sen.e: In Kyoto, the Ou-gun Army fought against Takauji ASHIKAGA, the representatives of the Northern Dynasty and put them to fligh to Kyushu.
In Kyoto, the Ou-gun Army fought against Takauji ASHIKAGA of the Northern Court faction and forced them to retreat to Kyushu.
sen.cmt: ・「, the representatives of the Northern Dynasty」→「of the Northern Court faction」・余計のスペースを削除・「put them to fligh」→「forced them to retreat」
sen.e: In Kyoto, the Ou-gun Army fought against Takauji ASHIKAGA of the Northern Court faction and forced them to retreat to Kyushu.

sen.j: さらに奥羽軍は、二度目の畿内遠征を敢行した。
sen.e: The Ou-gun Army ventured second expedition into Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).
The Ou-gun Army went on to conduct a second expedition into the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).
sen.cmt: ・「ventured」→「went on to conduct a」・「the」を追加
sen.e: The Ou-gun Army went on to conduct a second expedition into the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).

sen.j: しかし、このとき、奥州管領の岩切城主・畠山国氏 (奥州管領)、同じく奥州管領・吉良貞家は、北朝方として多賀城を攻撃し、義良親王一向を多賀城から福島県伊達郡霊山へ追いやった。
sen.e: However, at that time, Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA, the lord of Iwakiri-jo Castle and Oshu Kanrei (a governer of Oshu), and Sadaie KIRA, who was another governer of Oshu, attacked Taga-jo Castle as representatives of the Northen Dynasty, and drove away Prince and his men from Taga-jo Castle to Ryozen, Date-gun, Fukushima Prefecture.

However, during this time, Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA - lord of Iwakiri-jo Castle and Oshu Kanrei (shogunal deputy of the northern regions), and Sadaie KIRA - who was also an Oshu Kanrei, attacked Taga-jo Castle as representatives of the Northern Court, and drove Imperial Prince Norinaga and his men from Taga-jo Castle to Ryozen in Date District, Fukushima Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・「at that」→「during this」・「,」→「-」・「the」を削除・「a」を削除・「Oshu Kanrei (governer of Oshu)」→「Oshu Kanrei (shogunal deputy of the northern regions)」・「, who was another governer of Oshu」→「- who was also an Oshu Kanrei」・「Dynasty」→「Court」・「away prince」→「Imperial Prince Norinaga」・「, Date-gun」→「in Date District」
sen.e: However, during this time, Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA - lord of Iwakiri-jo Castle and Oshu Kanrei (shogunal deputy of the northern regions), and Sadaie KIRA - who was also an Oshu Kanrei, attacked Taga-jo Castle as representatives of the Northern Court, and drove Imperial Prince Norinaga and his men from Taga-jo Castle to Ryozen in Date District, Fukushima Prefecture.

sen.j: ところが、北朝では足利尊氏と弟・足利直義が仲間割れをし、観応の擾乱となった。
sen.e: However, in the Northern Dynasty, Takauji ASHIKAGA and his brother, Naoyoshi quarrelled among themselves, which led to Kanno Disturbance.
But at the Northern Court, an internal discord between Takauji ASHIKAGA and his younger brother Naoyoshi led to the Kanno Disturbance.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに再翻訳しました
sen.e: But at the Northern Court, an internal discord between Takauji ASHIKAGA and his younger brother Naoyoshi led to the Kanno Disturbance.

sen.j: 尊氏方の畠山国氏は直義方の吉良貞家と岩切城合戦を行った。
sen.e: Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA, who supported Takauji fought Sadaie KIRA in Battle of Iwakirijo.
Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA, who supported Takauji, fought Sadaie KIRA in the Battle of Iwakirijo.
Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA, who supported Takauji, fought Sadaie KIRA, who supported Naoyoshi, in the Battle of Iwakirijo.

sen.j: 畠山国氏は吉良貞家に破れ岩切城は落城。
sen.e: Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA was defeated by Sadaie KIRA, which lead to the fall of Iwakiri-jo Castle.
Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA was defeated by Sadaie KIRA, leading to the fall of Iwakiri-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: ・余計のスペースを削除・「which lead」→「leading」
sen.e: Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA was defeated by Sadaie KIRA, leading to the fall of Iwakiri-jo Castle.

sen.j: 畠山国氏は自害して果てた。
sen.e: Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA killed himself.
Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA committed suicide.
Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA committed suicide.

sen.j: 一方、弟・足利直義を殺して観応の擾乱に勝利を収めた足利尊氏は、霊山から出撃した奥羽軍の畿内遠征を白河で食い止めると、多賀城を再び攻略した。
sen.e: Takauji ASHIKAGA, who killed his brother Naoyoshi and won in Kanno Disturbance, stayed the Ou-gun Army's the expedition into Kinai region at Shirakawa, and captured Taga-jo Castle again.

Takauji ASHIKAGA, who killed his brother Naoyoshi and was victorious in the Kanno Disturbance, held back the Ou-gun Army's expedition into the Kinai region at Shirakawa, and recaptured Taga-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: ・「won in」→「was victorious in the」・「stayed」→「held back」・「the」を削除・「the」を補足・「captured Taga-jo Castle again」→「recaptured Taga-jo Castle」
sen.e: Takauji ASHIKAGA, who killed his brother Naoyoshi and was victorious in the Kanno Disturbance, held back the expedition into the Kinai region by Ou-gun Army from Ryozan, at Shirakawa, and recaptured Taga-jo Castle.

sen.j: 尊氏は京都を奪回し、後醍醐天皇は吉野へ逃れた。
sen.e: Takauji recuptured Kyoto and Emperor Godaigo fled to Yoshino.
Takauji retook Kyoto and Emperor Go-Daigo fled to Yoshino.
Takauji retook Kyoto and Emperor Go-Daigo fled to Yoshino.

sen.j: こうして、多賀国府を舞台とした奥羽地方政権は、完全に崩壊した。
sen.e: Therefore, the government at Ou region completely collapsed.
Therefore the Ou regional regime based at the Taga provincial office completely collapsed.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: Therefore the Ou regional regime based at the Taga provincial office completely collapsed.

sen.j: なお、後醍醐天皇は死に際し、義良親王に皇位を譲っている。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo, upon death, abdicated the imperial throne to Imperial Prince Norinaga.
Emperor Go-Daigo ceded the imperial throne to Imperial Prince Norinaga at the time of his death.
sen.cmt: ・「Godaigo」→「Go-Daigo」・ナチュラルに再翻訳しました
sen.e: Emperor Go-Daigo ceded the imperial throne to Imperial Prince Norinaga at the time of his death.

sen.j: 南北朝時代から室町時代を経て戦国時代 (日本)にかけての岩切城は、留守氏の居城として知られている。
sen.e: Iwakiri-jo Castle was known as the Rusu clan's residential castle from the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties to the Muromachi period and to the period of civil wars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From the Northern and Southern Courts period to the Muromachi and Sengoku (warring states) periods, Iwakiri-jo Castle was known as the residence of the Rusu clan.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに再翻訳しました
sen.e: From the Northern and Southern Courts period to the Muromachi and Sengoku (warring states) periods, Iwakiri-jo Castle was known as the residence of the Rusu clan.

sen.j: その所領は現在の岩切、利府町、多賀城市の一帯である。
sen.e: Its territory covered present Iwakiri, Rifu-cho and Tagajo City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its territory covered modern-day Iwakiri, Rifu-cho and Tagajo City.
Its territory covered modern-day Iwakiri, Rifu-cho and Tagajo City.

sen.j: 岩切城はその間、留守氏によって少しずつ整備が進められたものと考えられる。
sen.e: It is thought that the Rusu clan gradually adjusted Iwakiri-jo Castle while they owned it.
It is thought that the Rusu clan gradually maintained Iwakiri-jo Castle while they owned it.
It is thought that the Rusu clan gradually maintained Iwakiri-jo Castle while they owned it.

sen.j: 戦国時代末期には、伊達政宗が東北地方南部を征服した。
sen.e: At the end of the period of civil wars, Masamune DATE conquered the southern part of Tohoku region.
Masamune DATE conquered the southern part of the Tohoku region at the end of the end of the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: ・「the」を追加・「period of civil wars」→「Sengoku period」・再構成しました
sen.e: Masamune DATE conquered the southern part of the Tohoku region at the end of the end of the Sengoku period.

sen.j: 政宗は叔父の留守政景（伊達政景）を岩切城主とした。
sen.e: Masamune made his uncle, Masakage RUSU (Masakage DATE), the lord of the castle.
Masamune made his uncle, Masakage RUSU (Masakage DATE), lord of the castle.
Masamune made his uncle, Masakage RUSU (Masakage DATE), lord of the castle.

sen.j: 元亀年間(1570年～1573年)、政景は居城を利府城に移し、岩切城は廃城となった。
sen.e: From 1570 to 1573, Masakage moved his residential castle to Rifu-jo Castle and deserted Iwakiri-jo Castle,
Between 1570 and 1573, Masakage relocated to Rifu-jo Castle, and wakiri-jo Castle became abandoned.
sen.cmt: ・「From」→「Between」・「to」→「and」・「moved his residential castle」→「relocated」・コンマを削除・「deserted Iwakiri-jo Castle」→「Iwakiri-jo Castle became abandoned」・コンマ→ペリオド
sen.e: Between 1570 and 1573, Masakage relocated to Rifu-jo Castle, and wakiri-jo Castle became abandoned.

sen.j: 1982年（昭和57年）8月、岩切城跡は国の史跡に指定されており、現在は県民の森の一画をしめ、仙台有数の桜の名所となっている。
sen.e: In 1982, Iwakiri-jo Castle was designated as a national historical site and occupies a part of the forest of local residents and is one of the most famous cherry blossom viewing spots in Sendai.

Iwakiri-jo Castle was designated a national historical site and in 1982, currently occupies part of the Kenmin no Mori Forest Park, and is one of the most famous cherry blossom viewing spots in Sendai.
sen.cmt: ・「as」を削除・再構成・「and」→「, currently」・「forest of local residents」→「Kenmin no Mori Forest Park」・コンマを追加
sen.e: Iwakiri-jo Castle was designated a national historical site and in August 1982, currently occupies part of the Kenmin no Mori Forest Park, and is one of the most famous cherry blossom viewing spots in Sendai.

sen.j: 観光
sen.e: Sightseeing
Sightseeing
Sightseeing

sen.j: 仙台市宮城野区岩切
sen.e: Iwakiri, Miyagino Ward, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture
Iwakiri, Miyagino Ward, Sendai City
Iwakiri, Miyagino Ward, Sendai City

sen.j: 宮城郡利府町神谷沢
sen.e: Kamiyasawa, Rifu-cho, Miyagi Prefecture
Kamiyasawa, Rifu-cho, Miyagi District
Kamiyasawa, Rifu-cho, Miyagi District

sen.j: 東日本旅客鉄道東北本線岩切駅下車
sen.e: Getting off at JR East Tohoku Main Line Iwakiri Station
Alight at JR East Tohoku Main Line Iwakiri Station
Alight at JR East Tohoku Main Line Iwakiri Station
